edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image
Class LargePixelData

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.PixelData
      edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.LargePixelData
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class LargePixelData
extends PixelData

Holds image pixel data in a type-independent manner; handles conversion to the appropriate number format for the data being stored to disk.

This implementation uses a smaller memory footprint than a PixelData object by potentially only keeping a single image plane active at a time. The remainder of the image is stored in a memory-mapped file and converted to and from the float values available to users of this class as needed. This may lead to extra overhead when repeatedly retrieving pixel values from different planes, so where possible, it is recommended to structure code to do all the single plane processing possible before switching to another plane.

It is recommended that PixelData objects be constructed with a PixelDataFactory, which will choose whether to use the in-memory or disk-using version depending on the size of the image.

Author:
Colin J. Fuller
See Also:

Constructor Detail

LargePixelData

protected LargePixelData()

LargePixelData

public LargePixelData(ImageCoordinate sizes,
                      int data_type,
                      java.lang.String dimensionOrder)
Constructs a new LargePixelData object using an ImageCoordinate to specify the size of the pixeldata.

Parameters:
sizes - An ImageCoordinate that specifies the size of the pixeldata in all 5 (XYZCT) dimensions.
data_type - An integer that specifies the numeric type of the on-disk representation of this data; valid values are from FormatTools
dimensionOrder - A string made up of the characters "XYZCT" in any order that specifies the order of the dimensions in the on-disk representation.

LargePixelData

public LargePixelData(int size_x,
                      int size_y,
                      int size_z,
                      int size_c,
                      int size_t,
                      int data_type,
                      java.lang.String dimensionOrder)
Constructs a LargePixelData object with individual dimension sizes instead of the sizes lumped into an ImageCoordinate.

Parameters:
size_x - Size of the pixel data in the X-dimension.
size_y - Size of the pixel data in the Y-dimension.
size_z - Size of the pixel data in the Z-dimension.
size_c - Size of the pixel data in the C-dimension.
size_t - Size of the pixel data in the T-dimension.
data_type - An integer that specifies the numeric type of the on-disk representation of this data; valid values are from FormatTools
dimensionOrder - A string made up of the characters "XYZCT" in any order that specifies the order of the dimensions in the on-disk representation.

initMappedPixelData

protected void initMappedPixelData()
Maps a temporary file into memory to be used for the storage of the image binary data.

setBytes

public void setBytes(byte[] pixelBytes)
Sets the raw byte representation of the pixel data to the specified array.

Pixel values should be represented by the numeric type, byte order, and dimension order specified when initializing the PixelData. This will not be checked for the correct format.

The internal numerical representation of the pixel data will be updated immediately, and the data in the specified byte array will replace any existing data.

Overrides:
setBytes in class PixelData
Parameters:
pixelBytes - A byte array containing the new pixel data.

getByteOffsetForCurrentPlane

protected int getByteOffsetForCurrentPlane()
Determines the number of bytes into the byte array representation of the current pixel data where the current plane is located.

Returns:
The offset of the first byte of the current plane.

updateConvertedPixelsFromBytes

protected void updateConvertedPixelsFromBytes()
Reads the underlying byte array using the specified byte order, dimension order, and data format and stores the current plane from this array as an array of floats, which is accessed by users of this class.

This method is called internally whenever switching between image planes to load the currently selected plane from the memory mapped file to the float array representation of the current plane.

Overrides:
updateConvertedPixelsFromBytes in class PixelData

updateBytesFromConvertedPixels

protected void updateBytesFromConvertedPixels()
Converts the array of floats used for access by users of this class back to a byte array representation according to the stored byte order, dimension order, and data type.

This method is called internally before switching to a new image plane to write the current float array representation if the current image plane back to the memory-mapped file.

Overrides:
updateBytesFromConvertedPixels in class PixelData

getPlane

public byte[] getPlane(int index)
Get a single plane of the image formatted as a raw byte array.

A plane is defined as the extend of the PixelData in the x-y direction, so a single plane will reflect a single (Z,C,T) coordinate.

The byte array will be encoded as when calling PixelData.getBytes().

The planes are indexed according to the dimension order specified when initializing the PixelData.

Overrides:
getPlane in class PixelData
Parameters:
index - The index of the plane to return in the specified dimension order.
Returns:
A byte array holding the requested plane encoded in the specified format.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the dimension order does not start with XY or YX. This exception should never be thrown for the LargePixelData, as other dimension orderings are not supported for large images.

getPixel

public float getPixel(int x,
                      int y,
                      int z,
                      int c,
                      int t)
Gets the value of a single pixel at the specified coordinates.

Note that the parameters are passed in the order x,y,z,c,t regardless of the ordering in the underlying byte array representation and will be converted to the correct ordering automatically.

This method will have better performance on repeated calls within the same image plane than on repeated calls switching among different image planes, so a minimum of plane switching is recommended.

(All coordinates are zero-indexed.)

Overrides:
getPixel in class PixelData
Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the pixel to return.
y - The y-coordinate of the pixel to return.
z - The z-coordinate of the pixel to return.
c - The c-coordinate of the pixel to return.
t - The t-coordinate of the pixel to return.
Returns:
The value of the PixelData at the specified coordinates, as a float.

setPixel

public void setPixel(int x,
                     int y,
                     int z,
                     int c,
                     int t,
                     float value)
Gets the value of a single pixel at the specified coordinates.

Note that the parameters are passed in the order x,y,z,c,t regardless of the ordering in the underlying byte array representation and will be converted to the correct ordering automatically.

Likewise, though the value is passed as a float, it will be converted automatically to the underlying byte representation in the correct format. This may lead to the truncation of the passed float value when retrieving the byte array representation. However, the float passed in can still be retreived without truncation by calling getPixel(int, int, int, int, int) if the image plane has not been switched in the intervening time.

This method will have better performance on repeated calls within the same image plane than on repeated calls switching among different image planes, so a minimum of plane switching is recommended.

(All coordinates are zero-indexed.)

Overrides:
setPixel in class PixelData
Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of the pixel to return.
y - The y-coordinate of the pixel to return.
z - The z-coordinate of the pixel to return.
c - The c-coordinate of the pixel to return.
t - The t-coordinate of the pixel to return.
value - The value to which the pixel at the specified coordinates will be set.

Sets the byte order of the underlying byte array representation to one of the constants specified in ByteOrder

setByteOrder in class PixelData
Parameters:
b - The ByteOrder constant to which the byte order of the PixelData will be set.
